Module kivakit.application
Package com.telenav.kivakit.application

Class Application

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
com.telenav.kivakit.application.Application
All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationMetadata, Component, ResultTrait, LanguageTrait, SilentTryTrait, TryTrait, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver, ProjectTrait, RegistryTrait, Versioned, JavaTrait, TripwireTrait, Receiver, Transmitter, Named, NamedObject, PackageTrait, SettingsTrait
Direct Known Subclasses:
Server
public abstract class Application extends BaseComponent implements Named, ApplicationMetadata
Base class for KivaKit applications.

This class provides:

  • Project Initialization - Initializes Projects used by the application
  • Application Metadata - Provides information about the application and its environment
  • Application Environment - Provides information about the execution environment
  • Application Execution - Runs the application
  • Command Line Parsing - Parses command line switches and arguments
  • Messaging and Logging - Captures and logs Messages broadcast by child components

Application is also a Component and so it inherits:

  • PackageTrait - Provides access to packages and packaged resources
  • SettingsTrait - Loads settings objects and deployment configurations
  • RegistryTrait - Service Registry access
  • LanguageTrait - Enhancements that reduce language verbosity
  • Repeater - Message broadcasting, listening and repeating
  • NamedObject - Provides component name

Creating an Application

An Application subclass should be constructed in the main(String[]) Java application entrypoint and the run(String[]) method should be called on it. This can be done in one step: 

 public class MyApplication extends Application
 {
     public static void main(String[] arguments)
     {
         new MyApplication().run(arguments);
     }

     [...]
 }

Project Initialization

Application constructors should pass one or more Projects to the Application constructor to ensure that all of the application's transitively dependent project(s) are initialized. See Project for details.

Application Metadata

Applications provide ApplicationMetadata about themselves:

  • version() - The version of this application
  • description() - A description of this application
  • identifier() - A unique identifier for the application class

Application Environment

Applications can access information about their execution environment:

  • properties() - System and environment properties
  • localizedProperties(Locale) - Properties that are specific to the Locale

Execution

Lifecycle

The run(String[]) method performs the following steps:

  1. Call onProjectsInitializing()
  2. Initialize and install the Project passed to the constructor
  3. Call onProjectsInitialized()
  4. Parse command line arguments using:
    • The ArgumentParsers returned by argumentParsers()
    • The SwitchParsers returned by switchParsers()
  5. Call onRunning()
  6. Call onRun(), executing the application
  7. Call onRan()
  8. Exit

Abnormal Termination

If an application wishes to terminate its execution abnormally, it can call exit(String, Object...). This will display the given message and show command line usage before exiting the application.

Command Line Parsing

Within the onRun() method, the Application class provides convenient access to a model of the command line:

Command Line

  • commandLine() - Gets the parsed command line
  • startupInformation(String) - Returns a text box describing the command line with the given title
  • showStartupInformation() - Broadcasts the command line description as an Announcement message

Switches

  • get(SwitchParser) - Gets the switch value for the given switch parser
  • has(SwitchParser) - Determines if there is a switch value for the given switch parser

Arguments

  • argumentList() - Gets command line arguments (excluding switches)
  • argument(ArgumentParser) - Gets the first command line argument (excluding switches)
  • argument(int, ArgumentParser) - Gets the nth argument using the given argument parser

Messaging and Logging

This class extends BaseRepeater and has a Logger that listens for messages and logs them.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • ready

      public void ready()

    • run

      public final void run(String[] arguments)
      Runs the application by calling onRun() given the arguments from the Java main(String[]) application entrypoint. Operations occur in this order:
      1. onRunning() is called to indicate that running is about to start
      2. Command line arguments are validated and parsed into a CommandLine
      3. onConfigureListeners() is called to allow redirection of output
      4. onProjectsInitializing() is called before the Project for this application is initialized
      5. Project.initialize() is called
      6. onProjectsInitialized() is called
      7. onRun() is called
      8. onRan() is called
      9. The application exits
      Parameters:
      arguments - Command line arguments to parse

    • showStartupInformation

      public void showStartupInformation()

    • startupInformation

      public String startupInformation(String title)
      Returns:
      This command line in a text box intended for user feedback when starting an application

    • waitForReady

      public void waitForReady()
      Waits until the ready() method is called in the onRun() implementation to indicate that the application is fully ready. If ready() is not called, this method will never return.
